description: From Armenian լավաշ (lavaš) and partly from Turkish lavaş.. Probably ultimately from some Aramaic language. See the former for more.

entries.meaning: A soft, thin flatbread made with flour, water, yeast, and salt, baked in a tandoor. Toasted sesame seeds and/or poppy seeds are sometimes sprinkled on it before baking. Traditionally made in Armenia and other countries of the Caucasus and the Middle East.
